content.question:
For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

<math alttext="C 2 H 4 gas, plus 3 O 2 gas, react to produce 2 C O 2 gas, plus 2 H 2 O, liquid. Delta H naught sub 1, equals question mark."><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

The combustion of <math alttext="C 2 H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above.

(a) Use the enthalpies of formation in the table below to calculate the value of <math alttext="delta H naught sub 1"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow></math> for the reaction.

<math alttext="delta H naught of formation, in kilojoules per mole"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mtext>(kJ/mol)</mtext></mrow></math>

<math alttext="C 2 H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
       <math alttext="52"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>52</mn> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="C O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 394"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>394</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H 2 O, liquid"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 286"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>286</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="O 2 gas"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></math>
        <math alttext="0"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

frqParts.text:
For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

<math alttext="C 2 H 4 gas, plus 3 O 2 gas, react to produce 2 C O 2 gas, plus 2 H 2 O, liquid. Delta H naught sub 1, equals question mark."><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

The combustion of <math alttext="C 2 H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above.

(a) Use the enthalpies of formation in the table below to calculate the value of <math alttext="delta H naught sub 1"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow></math> for the reaction.

<math alttext="delta H naught of formation, in kilojoules per mole"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup><mspace linebreak="newline"></mspace><mtext>(kJ/mol)</mtext></mrow></math>

<math alttext="C 2 H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
       <math alttext="52"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>52</mn> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="C O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 394"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>394</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H 2 O, liquid"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 286"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>286</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="O 2 gas"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></math>
        <math alttext="0"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

(b) The energy of the reactants is shown on the energy diagram above. On the right side of the energy diagram, draw a horizontal line segment to indicate the energy of the products. Draw a vertical line segment to indicate <math alttext="delta H"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction, and label it with the correct value.

<math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H, liquid, plus 3 O 2 gas, react to produce 2 C O 2 gas, plus 3 H 2 O, liquid. Delta H naught sub 2, equals negative 1370 kilojoules per mole of reaction"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></mstyle><mtext>(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="1.0em"></mspace><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>1370</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>
(c) Based on the information above, identify the <math alttext="delta H naught"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> values that should be added together to determine the value of <math alttext="delta H naught of reaction"><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math> for the following reaction.
<math alttext="C 2 H 4 gas, plus H 2 O, liquid, react to produce C 2 H 5 O H, liquid"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.A: Represent chemical phenomena using appropriate graphing techniques, including correct scale and units.
